intro: Gaudinopsis macra subsp. antalyensis, commonly known as the Antalya gaudinopsis, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing adaptations to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and aromatic, while its flowers are white or pale green, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It is a relatively rare subspecies, making it of interest to botanists and conservationists.
